intro: Atrichodendron tonkinense, commonly known as the Tonkin hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, or white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
